intro: You have the option to upload a template file, which specifies the setup of the ddPCR reactions for your experiment. For specifications on how this file needs to be formatted, please check the dropClust page on Github. If you do not have one available, just upload the csv files directly and dropVis will create a standard template, which you can edit.
Here you can set up the template after you uploaded the csv files or edit the template you uploaded.
Here you can upload the raw data files from a Bio-Rad ddPCR run. For specifications on how these files needs to be formatted, please check the dropClust page on Github.
Run a simpler version of the algorithm that is about 10x faster. For clean data, this can already deliver good results. In any case useful to get a quick overview over the data.
Once the everything is set up, let the magic begin!
